solution_line_template: There are {num_coworkers} co-workers and each of their meals is ${meal_cost_per_person} so {num_coworkers}*{meal_cost_per_person} = $<<{num_coworkers}*{meal_cost_per_person}={total_meal_cost}>>{total_meal_cost}

They order {num_appetizers} appetizers at ${appetizer_cost_each} each so {num_appetizers}*{appetizer_cost_each} = $<<{num_appetizers}*{appetizer_cost_each}={total_appetizer_cost}>>{total_appetizer_cost}

The meals costs ${total_meal_cost} and the appetizers costs ${total_appetizer_cost} for a total of {total_meal_cost}+{total_appetizer_cost} = $<<{total_meal_cost}+{total_appetizer_cost}={subtotal_cost}>>{subtotal_cost}
A {tip_percent_num}% tip on the ${subtotal_cost} order is {tip_percent_decimal}*{subtotal_cost} = $<<{tip_percent_decimal}*{subtotal_cost}={tip_amount}>>{tip_amount}

So the meal is ${subtotal_cost}, the tip is ${tip_amount} and he adds a ${rush_order_fee} rush for a total of {subtotal_cost}+{tip_amount}+{rush_order_fee} = $<<{subtotal_cost}+{tip_amount}+{rush_order_fee}={total_spend}>>{total_spend}
